articles.headline: Obama’s Pick for Treasury Is Said to Be His Chief of Staff
articles.snippet: President Obama will announce on Thursday that he intends to elevate Jacob J. Lew to be the next secretary of Treasury, officials familiar with the decision said.
articles.abstract: President Obama will announce on Thursday that he intends to elevate Jacob J. Lew to be the next secretary of Treasury, officials familiar with the decision said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With his choice of Jacob J. Lew to be the secretary of Treasury, President Obama on Thursday will complete the transformation of his economic team from the big-name economists and financial firefighters hired four years ago to budget negotiators ready for the next fiscal fights in Congress.

articles.headline: Public Goals, Private Interests in Debt Campaign
articles.snippet: Close to half of the members of Fix the Debt’s board and steering committee have ties to companies that have engaged in lobbying on taxes and spending.
articles.abstract: Close to half of the members of Fix the Debt’s board and steering committee have ties to companies that have engaged in lobbying on taxes and spending.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jim McCrery, a former Louisiana congressman, urged lawmakers last month to pursue entitlement cuts and tax reform, he was introduced on television as a leader of Fix the Debt, a group of business executives and onetime legislators who have become Washington’s most visible and best-financed advocates for reining in the federal deficit.

articles.headline: Bringing the Calendar Up to Date
articles.snippet: Why are digital calendars still modeled after paper ones when modern design, features and flexibility cry out to be used?
articles.abstract: Why are digital calendars still modeled after paper ones when modern design, features and flexibility cry out to be used?
articles.lead_paragraph: You know what’s kind of wild? We can identify products by their container designs. You’d know a ketchup bottle, even if it was empty and unlabeled, no matter what the brand. You’d know a pickle jar, or a milk jug, or a bottle of salad dressing, or a cereal box just by their container shapes.

articles.headline: A.I.G. Says It Will Not Join Lawsuit Against Government
articles.snippet: The board of the American International Group has declined to join a lawsuit against the federal government over its $182 billion taxpayer-financed bailout, the company said on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: The board of the American International Group has declined to join a lawsuit against the federal government over its $182 billion taxpayer-financed bailout, the company said on Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Ben Protess

articles.headline: Deep Cuts Raise Questions About Morgan Stanley
articles.snippet: Morgan Stanley has been shrinking its business of trading bonds, commodities and other investments, leaving that to be dominated by its Wall Street rivals.
articles.abstract: Morgan Stanley has been shrinking its business of trading bonds, commodities and other investments, leaving that to be dominated by its Wall Street rivals.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Morgan Stanley’s top executives gathered in mid-September at the Gramercy Park Hotel in Manhattan to discuss strategy, some participants complained that the room was too small.

articles.headline: Chávez, or at Least His Sash, Is Set for Venezuela Inauguration
articles.snippet: President Hugo Chávez’s health crisis and decision to proceed on Thursday with a quasi-presidential inauguration that he is unable to attend is producing national angst about who is in charge.
articles.abstract: President Hugo Chávez’s health crisis and decision to proceed on Thursday with a quasi-presidential inauguration that he is unable to attend is producing national angst about who is in charge.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — President Hugo Chávez’s supporters have not ruled out swearing him in from his hospital in Havana. His detractors are calling for government investigators to go check his pulse themselves. The justices whom Mr. Chávez’s allies have named to the Supreme Court have decided that he can continue to govern in absentia.

articles.headline: U.S. Consumer Watchdog to Issue Mortgage Rules
articles.snippet: In an attempt to prevent future housing crises, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is issuing new laws for lenders.
articles.abstract: In an attempt to prevent future housing crises, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is issuing new laws for lenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Banks and other lenders will be prohibited from making home loans that offer deceptive teaser rates or require no documentation from borrowers, and will be required to take more steps to ensure that borrowers can repay, under new consumer protections to be announced on Thursday.

articles.headline: 3 Kurds Are Killed in Paris, in Locked-Door Mystery
articles.snippet: The deaths of three women opened up questions about whether the killings were linked to the long struggle for Kurdish autonomy in Turkey.
articles.abstract: The deaths of three women opened up questions about whether the killings were linked to the long struggle for Kurdish autonomy in Turkey.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The three Kurdish women were murdered, two with bullets to the head, the third with a shot to the stomach. It was a carefully planned killing in a nondescript building in central Paris.
articles.byline: By Dan Bilefsky and Alan Cowell
